title: How to Stick with Good Habits Every Day
summary: Habit tracking is one of the most effective ways to maintain consistency. The mere act of tracking a behavior can change it. Never miss twice—if you miss one day, get back on track immediately. Use habit tracking to make your progress visible and maintain momentum.
keyIdeas: Habit tracking is a simple way to make habits satisfying.
The act of tracking a behavior can change the behavior itself.
Never miss twice—one miss is an accident, two misses is the start of a new habit.
Make tracking as easy as possible—automate when you can.
Visual progress is motivating and reinforces consistency.
Habit tracking provides immediate satisfaction and long-term awareness.
The best habit tracker is one you'll actually use.
examples: Mark an X on a calendar each day you complete your habit.
Use a habit tracking app to monitor multiple behaviors.
Keep a simple journal to track your daily progress.
Create a visual chart to see your streak and progress.
exercises: Start tracking one habit using a simple method (calendar, app, or journal).
Set a rule: never miss your habit twice in a row.
Create a visual representation of your habit streak.
reflections: What habit would benefit most from tracking?
How can you make habit tracking automatic and effortless?
